data.title: Observer 10 Feb 2011 - Oman Observer
data.text: Food Fest a hit with revellers — Features Thursday, February 10, 2011/Rabee al Awal 6, 1432 AH www.omanobserver.om editor@omanobserver.om Max Min Muscat 26 15 Seeb 26 15 Sohar 24 16 Salalah 29 19 OCA praise for Oman SHAIKH Ahmed al Fahd al Sabah, President of Olympic Council of Asia, says he is proud of the successful staging of the Beach Games. “My deepest appreciation goes to His Majesty Sultan Qaboos,” he said. Al Musannah Sports City is a wonderful legacy for Oman, and will benefit many generations, he noted. See page 19 Record by DME Oman Crude Futures Contract By A Staff Reporter MUSCAT — The Dubai Mercantile Exchange Limited (DME) announced that it set new trading records during the month of January 2011 with average daily volumes being the highest since the launch of the exchange. Average daily volumes (ADV) for the DME Oman Crude Oil Futures Contract (DME Oman) in January stood at 3,570 contracts (equivalent to 3.5 million barrels of oil per day), with a record total of 71,396 contracts traded throughout the month. This steady performance builds on the 35 per cent year-on-year increase in trading levels reported for 2010. January’s performance in- SOHAR — The Sohar Polyclinic was opened yesterday under the auspices of Abdullah bin Saleh al Habsi, the State Adviser, in the presence of Dr Mohammed bin Saif al Hosni, Under- Secretary of the Health Ministry for Health Affairs. Salim bin Hassan Ba Alawi, Director-General of Health Services in Northern Al Batinah Region, in a speech said that the RO 5.733 million complex built on an area of 4430 square metres started receiving patients on July 6, 2010. The complex provides primary and ordinary health care services. It also includes a primary check-up room, clinics for males and females, specialised clinics such as internal medicine, dermatology, surgery, orthopaedic, ear, nose and throat, ophthalmology, mental illness and diabetic foot. — ONA Dhuhr 12.26 pm Asr 03.40 pm Maghrib 06.04 pm Isha 07.15 pm Fajr 05.27 am dicators demonstrate continuing confidence in the DME Oman contract as the most efficient price discovery and risk management tool for the East of Suez crude oil markets. AFP adds: Meanwhile, world oil prices climbed back above $100 yesterday. Brent North Sea crude for delivery in March advanced 68 cents to $100.68 per barrel. New York’s main futures contract, light sweet crude for March, which is also known as West Texas Intermediate (WTI), gained 40 cents to $87.34. At the same time, the differential between Brent oil and New York crude has hit a record amount, as abundant US supplies continued to weigh on the WTI contract. See also page 7 Sohar Polyclinic opens MUSCAT — Both the medical fraternity and the people of Oman have been flattered by the award from the Government of the United Kingdom to Professor Nicholas Woodhouse of the College of Medicine of Sultan Qaboos University. This award marks the international recognition of the remarkable achievement of the Government of Oman in raising the standard of health in Oman over the last 40 years. This is simply demonstrated by the increase in the expected life of the population at birth from 49.4 years in 1970 to 79.4 years in 2008, and the fall in infant mortality from 129 per thousand births NEW YORK — UN Security Council members were discussing a proposal to send a delegation to the Middle East amid unrest in Egypt that could threaten UN programmes in the broader region, diplomats said yesterday. Russia’s UN Ambassador Vitaly Churkin has suggested 6 13 20 Industry sector to get boost By Abdulaziz al Jahdhami/ONA MUSCAT — The 8th fiveyear development plan (2011- 2015) focuses on development of basic industries and small and medium industries complementing them in a bid to increase the contributions of the industry to the GDP and boost the rate of annual growth of UK honour a recognition of achievements in health in 1970 to 9.1 per thousand over the same period. A major factor in the improvement of medical care to the people of Oman is due to the foresight of the government in providing higher education for the cohorts of students educated in the new schools built since the Renaissance. Professor Woodhouse, working with Omani colleagues and specialists in various medical fields from many countries around the world, together with hospital staff both in the University Hospital, and the hospitals of the Ministry of Health, have developed high standards of medical education. US Ambassador Susan Rice told reporters that council members were concerned by the situation, but needed to know the clear ob- Great care to scientific research Infrastructure to lure investors Industrial estate in Ibri in offing exports. Speaking at the celebrations marking the Omani Industrial Day at Muscat Intercontinental Hotel yesterday, Maqbool bin UN discusses likely trip to Egypt jectives and achievements for such a trip. “Council members, including us, were very clear that this is something that we would have to consider very, very carefully and consult with our capitals,” Rice told reporters at UN headquarters. Related reports, page 16 A FILE picture of the Greek-registered tanker Irene SL which was seized by pirates yesterday. — Reuters Ali bin Sultan, Commerce and Industry Minister, asserted that the Sultanate will continue its steady strides in industrial development by promoting the efficiency and competitiveness of the industrial sector, attaching care to scientific research and development and placing the geological bases required to ensure better utilisation of mineral resources. Maqbool pointed out that the celebration is a continuation of the integrated traditions that stem To page 3 HONG KONG — South Asia is facing a health crisis, with rising rates of heart disease, diabetes and obesity, and patients facing impoverishment as they pay for treatment out of their own pockets, the World Bank said yesterday. Although the region is growing economically and people are generally living longer lives, the poor have had little benefit from improved conditions, healthier nutrition, rising incomes or access to good healthcare, the Bank Unstable weather continues LATEST weather charts show that the unstable weather conditions that prevailed in high altitudes over the northern parts of the Sultanate yesterday will continue till Saturday. Partial cloudy skies are forecast over Musandam and coastal areas along the Sea of Oman and over Al Hajar Mountains with possible intermittent rains. By Bader al Kiyumi MUSCAT — Petroleum Development Oman’s EcOman Centre was opened at the Oil and Gas Exhibition yesterday. The centre is designed to make aware the public about the possibilities of harnessing sustainable energy resources for brighter future. Sayyid Said bin Ibrahim al Busaidy, Deputy Governor of Muscat, presided over the opening of the centre. The EcOman Centre is considered as one of the three best museums in the Sultanate. The centre also does so by offering hands-on experiments and experiences that communicate directly how energy and electricity work and how MUSCAT — The Ministry of Fisheries yesterday held a seminar on fish quality at the office of the Wali of Seeb under the auspices of Shaikh Mohammed bin Abdullah al Busaidy, Wali of Seeb. Salim bin Darwish al Hosni, Director-General of Fisheries Resources in the wilayat, said that the seminar was an opportunity to Rising incidence of heart disease EcOman: focus on energy resources said in a report. The report, covering Bangladesh, India, Nepal, Pakistan, Afghanistan, Maldives, Bhutan and Sri Lanka, said South Asians suffer their first heart attacks at 53, six years earlier than people anywhere else. Heart disease is now the leading cause of death for South Asians. Such non-communicable diseases account for 55 per cent of the region’s total disease burden. — Reuters they can make a change. It helps people understand how they can make a difference with special interactive exhibits that have been prepared by a specialist company based in the Netherlands. Raoul Restucci, Managing Director, PDO, said: “The EcOman Centre will make people understand that they can gradually shift from non-renewable fossil fuels to renewable sources like solar energy, wind, geothermal, hydropower and biomass. The centre helps visitors to understand our consumption habits and energy use at home or work locations. It allows us to understand waste and more efficient alternatives and make decisions To page 2 Priority for fish quality exchange views and information about the fisheries resources sector. Al Hosni noted that the ministry pays much attention to the fish quality as it is one of the priorities being continuously supported and developed by the ministry whether on the level of fishermen, transporters, dealers, fish products and the consumers. To page 3 MUSCAT — The Royal Navy of Oman (RNO) yesterday held a joint naval exercise of search and rescue with the Iranian Navy, supported by the Royal Air Force of Oman and Royal Oman Police.
